descriptions.description: Developer turnover reduces the core developer stock as experienced members leave the project.
The skill up flow increases the new contributor stock by transitioning individuals from the onboarding pool.
The skill up flow increases experienced contributors by promoting members who have gained sufficient proficiency.
The promotion rate flow increases experienced contributors by advancing capable new contributors into this role.
The promotion rate flow increases core developers by promoting the most experienced and committed contributors.
Implicit knowledge transfer accelerates the skill up flow by providing hands-on guidance and mentorship.
Increased implicit knowledge transfer raises the promotion rate by preparing contributors for more advanced roles.
More core developers increase implicit knowledge transfer capacity through their availability to mentor others.
Explicit knowledge transfer facilitates the skill up flow by providing accessible learning materials and guides.
The colored stock (potential contributor pool) increases new contributors as individuals decide to join the project.
A larger stock of new contributors increases the skill up flow as more people are in the learning pipeline.
A larger core developer group can increase turnover due to burnout or natural career progression over time.
More experienced contributors increase the promotion rate by providing a larger candidate pool for core developer roles.
